message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SY. 

This paper is likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category because it proposes a highly scalable sharding framework for blockchain, which is a distributed system. It may also belong to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category because it proposes a new Byzantine agreement protocol and a verifiable random function. Additionally, it may belong to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category because it introduces a new data structure called the blocklattice. It could also be categorized under Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) because it discusses communication overhead and latency. Finally, it may belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category because it proposes a new consensus algorithm for a replicated state machine.
